definition: to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.chinese: 我们对落败者表示同情。

sentences.english: Visible American in China and" game", already lost.
sentences.chinese: 可见美国在与中国的经贸“博弈”中，早已落败。

sentences.english: Buckman is expected, Obama will lose the presidential election next year.
sentences.chinese: 巴克曼则预计，奥巴马将在明年的总统选举中落败。

sentences.english: It may yet lose the war for market share.
sentences.chinese: 但该公司仍有可能在争夺市场份额的大战中落败。

sentences.english: Krugman effectively conceded defeat on a range of economic debates.
sentences.chinese: 克鲁格曼实际上承认了自己在一系列经济辩论中落败。

sentences.english: Manchester United have won eight of their last nine league games following a defeat.
sentences.chinese: 红军在安菲尔德近九场英超赛事，仅一场落败。

sentences.english: Defeated warriors (samurai) often resorted to hara-kiri.
sentences.chinese: 落败的武士总是采用切腹的死法。

sentences.english: Both of them agree to have a baseball competition.
sentences.chinese: 他们协议比赛棒球，那方落败便要离开球场。

sentences.english: Rovers lost 4-1 and began their long exile from the First Division.
sentences.chinese: 流浪者队以1比4落败，从此开始长期无缘甲级联赛。

sentences.english: Liverpool have lost just one of their last 9 Premier League matches at Anfield.
sentences.chinese: 红军在安菲尔德近九场英超赛事，仅一场落败。

sentences.english: Why did he keep losing to less skilled players?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他在对阵实力比自己弱的对手时总是落败？

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
no match for/cannot beat
victorious/to win/to triumph
to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to defeat/to beat
to lose/to suffer defeat
to suffer a crushing defeat
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
to prevail over/to defeat/to surmount
to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
bitter struggle/hard battle/arduous effort
to lose
confrontation/contest/showdown
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
